meanings.sent1: Some people have strange pishoges about black cats bringing bad luck.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her lucky charm with her due to her pishoges.
meanings.sent3: His pishoges led him to wear mismatched socks on exam days.
meanings.sent4: The pishoges surrounding Friday the 13th are deeply ingrained in some cultures.
meanings.sent5: The village was full of pishoges, from avoiding cracks on the sidewalk to throwing salt over the shoulder.

meanings.sent1: Don't pishoges by walking under ladders, it's considered bad luck.
meanings.sent2: She tends to pishoges by knocking on wood whenever she mentions something unfortunate.
meanings.sent3: He would pishoges by avoiding stepping on cracks in the pavement.
meanings.sent4: The old sailor would pishoges by always wearing his lucky hat at sea.
meanings.sent5: The team decided to pishoges by wearing their lucky socks to the championship game.

meanings.definition: A person who believes in superstitions
meanings.sent1: She is known as the pishoges of the family, always following superstitions.
meanings.sent2: The pishoges was convinced that breaking a mirror would bring seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The pishoges was teased by friends for carrying around a rabbit's foot for good luck.
meanings.sent4: The old man was considered the village pishoges due to his strong belief in superstitions.
meanings.sent5: The pishoges was consulted by many for advice on avoiding bad omens.
